meanings.definition: The act of omitting or neglecting to do something.
meanings.sent1: Her pretermissions of homework assignments led to lower grades.
meanings.sent2: The pretermissions of watering the plants caused them to wither.
meanings.sent3: The pretermissions of feeding the cat resulted in a very hungry feline!
meanings.sent4: His pretermissions were like holes in a safety net, letting important tasks slip through.
meanings.sent5: The pretermissions in his work were as noticeable as a missing puzzle piece.

meanings.definition: Failure to perform an expected duty or obligation.
meanings.sent1: The pretermissions of paying rent led to eviction.
meanings.sent2: Her pretermissions of attending meetings caused misunderstandings.
meanings.sent3: The pretermissions of doing laundry made his room look like a clothing store.
meanings.sent4: Their pretermissions were like cracks in a dam, causing chaos to flood in.
meanings.sent5: The pretermissions in his promises were as disappointing as deflated balloons.
